intro: Leptoglottis latidens, commonly known as the broad-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and tall, slender stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Due to its ecological importance, it is considered a valuable species for biodiversity and habitat conservation.
